{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3662780,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-24T18:18:13.984Z","cooked":"

From the creators of YAGSL

Hey FRC teams,

We’re excited to open beta access to a new mechanisms library (name TBD), built to make implementing common FRC mechanisms — like elevators, arms, and turrets — simple, reusable, and simulation-ready.

It’s 100% code-configured, has built-in simulation and telemetry, and is fully command-based.

Currently supports:

  • Elevators
  • Single-jointed arms
  • Turrets

Library Highlights

  • Code-only configuration

    • No JSON files — everything is in Java

  • Built-in simulation + telemetry

    • Just call a method in simulationPeriodic()
    • Sim and real share 100% of your subsystem code

  • Command-based design

    • Integrates directly with WPILib commands

  • AdvantageKit replay support (planned)

    • Minimal or no code changes required

  • Fast iteration, clean architecture, and powerful tuning workflows

Simulation Demo

(Here’s what simulation looks like using the mechanisms library — telemetry and sim come built in.)


  • The orange line is the arm
  • The pink and yellow line is the soft limits
  • The green and red lines are the hard limits (physical stops)

With this view you can easily see when your subsystem may exceed the soft-limits as shown above and simulate hard limits as well, saving your team time and effort!

Example: Full Arm Subsystem

Here’s what a simple arm subsystem looks like using the mechanisms library. This code works in both real and simulated environments with zero duplication.

public class ArmSubsystem extends SubsystemBase
{

  private final TalonFXS                   armMotor    = new TalonFXS(1);//, MotorType.kBrushless);
  private final SmartMotorControllerConfig motorConfig = new SmartMotorControllerConfig(this)
      .withClosedLoopController(4, 0, 0, DegreesPerSecond.of(180), DegreesPerSecondPerSecond.of(90))
      .withSoftLimit(Degrees.of(-30), Degrees.of(100))
      .withGearing(gearing(gearbox(3, 4)))
      .withIdleMode(MotorMode.BRAKE)
      .withTelemetry("ArmMotor", TelemetryVerbosity.HIGH)
      .withStatorCurrentLimit(Amps.of(40))
      .withMotorInverted(false)
      .withClosedLoopRampRate(Seconds.of(0.25))
      .withOpenLoopRampRate(Seconds.of(0.25))
      .withFeedforward(new ArmFeedforward(0, 0, 0, 0))
      .withControlMode(ControlMode.CLOSED_LOOP);
  private final SmartMotorController       motor       = new TalonFXSWrapper(armMotor, DCMotor.getNEO(1), motorConfig);
  private final ArmConfig                  m_config    = new ArmConfig(motor)
      .withLength(Meters.of(0.135))
      .withHardLimit(Degrees.of(-100), Degrees.of(200))
      .withTelemetry("ArmExample", TelemetryVerbosity.HIGH)
      .withMass(Pounds.of(1))
      .withStartingPosition(Degrees.of(0))
      .withHorizontalZero(Degrees.of(0));
  private final Arm                        arm         = new Arm(m_config);

  public ArmSubsystem()
  {
  }

  public void periodic()
  {
    arm.updateTelemetry();
  }

  public void simulationPeriodic()
  {
    arm.simIterate();
  }

  public Command armCmd(double dutycycle)
  {
    return arm.set(dutycycle);
  }

  public Command sysId()
  {
    return arm.sysId(Volts.of(3), Volts.of(3).per(Second), Second.of(30));
  }

  public Command setAngle(Angle angle)
  {
    return arm.setAngle(angle);
  }
}

That’s it — no JSON, no special sim hacks, no custom telemetry setup.

You now have:

  • A PID + feedforward-controlled arm
  • Built-in logging
  • Simulation and telemetry support
  • SysId support
  • One place to maintain configuration

Limitations

  • No merged/multi-mechanism simulation (and no plans to add it)
  • Beta software — expect changes based on user feedback

Join the Beta

Want to try it out?

Join us here:
https://discord.gg/yagsl

Then request mechanism library beta access and we’ll get you started.

Bonus: Help Wanted! Mechanism Code Generator + Web-Based Sim

We’re also working on a web-based simulator + code generator project to pair with the mechanisms library.

What It Is

  • Web-based simulator using WPILib’s sim infrastructure
    Fully functional
  • Mechanism code template generator
    In progress — seeking contributors

The goal:

Build a mechanism in the browser → simulate it → export real code using the mechanisms library.

What’s Done

  • Web-based simulator works!
  • Code generation templates in progress

We’re Looking For:

  • Java devs
  • Contributors interested in simulation, UI, or codegen
  • Teams who want to test or shape templates

Join the same Discord and ask about the codegen + sim project to get connected.

Let us know what you’d like to see supported next — and we’ll keep building based on what teams need most.

— The YAGSL Dev Team

We’re excited to open beta access to a new mechanisms library (name TBD)

I vote for Yet Another Mechanism LIbrary

nstrike:

Code-only configuration

  • No JSON files — everything is in Java

As long as configuration is also done in YAML

Abbreviation Requests CD Forum Support
Dear diary, After months of preparation, lots of long sleepless night I have finally achieved the dream. YAGSL is a recognized CD abbreviation! I can now move on to YAGAL (Yet Another Generic Arm Library) for simplifying 6DOF pose estimation and control. /J above Seriously congrats!

It only took 6 months from my joke! This is much better then my original idea so seriously awesome work! Can’t wait to try this out

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-06-25T09:54:16.330Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":589,"readers_count":588,"score":252.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503589,"topic_slug":"beta-frc-mechanisms-library-elevators-arms-turrets-w-sim-telemetry-built-in","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/abbreviation-requests/446848/236","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Abbreviation Requests","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/beta-frc-mechanisms-library-elevators-arms-turrets-w-sim-telemetry-built-in/503589/8","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3663971,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-25T14:27:30.595Z","cooked":"

As soon as your PR is accepted to recalc i will modify the url gen the mechanism generator currently has to support it. Although i will not make it so the forms are a 1:1 duplicate. Teams can modify the recalc page if they want more granular control

What is your plan to account for different latency, frequency, backlash and noise across implementations and product ecosystems?

On the ReCalc side, for anything that we can’t infer from the page config you have to affirmatively enter a nonzero value into a box with a big red border and a warning label telling you not to just make it up.

image719×443 32.9 KB

There’s nothing we can do about the fundamental issue of “if you specify your mechanism wrong then the gains will be wrong.” But, the code generator should be able to correctly enter the gains in the right units for you, at least.

This might not be very relevant to the topic, but RIP to our team’s offseason project​:sob:. We have intended to develop a one-size-fits-all “mechanism system” that contains simulation logging and feedforward calculation, which is almost exactly what you are doing, except that we planned to use Isaac Sim and support multi-mechanisms.

Our URL map:

微信图片_202506252350461920×1382 286 KB

The good thing is we haven’t put too much effort into it yet, so we can try gently modifying the framework and implement multi-mechanism and many other things we want to achieve.

Indeed, an amazing project, though, and I appreciate all the effort you have put in to make this fantastic library.

This is crazy. We might be a couple years out from lower-level FRC software being 100% plug and play. Imagine a world where every team can start from a baseline and focus on higher level integration and automation.

Thats the goal

Next season you should be able to plug everything into the code gen and tune your mechanism theorhetically assuming “normal” weight distribution.

Then you can take those values and plug them into the mechanism library and have an FRC sim and replay capability with minimal changes.

CakeDeer6:

We might be a couple years out from lower-level FRC software being 100% plug and play.

Per the above discussion on units and GIGO, I don’t think “100% plug and play” is a thing that can ever really be achieved. But we can definitely get to a place where there is never any need to reverse-engineer someone else’s starter template.
